name: Isaac
blurb: The son of promise, Isaac embodies God’s fidelity to His word. Spared on Moriah (Gen 22), he receives Abraham’s covenant and becomes father to Esau and Jacob. Isaac’s narrative is quieter yet pivotal,
searchText: isaac person narrative the son of promise, isaac embodies god’s fidelity to his word. spared on moriah (gen 22), he receives abraham’s covenant and becomes father to esau and jacob. isaac’s narrative is quieter yet pivotal, showing god’s promise advancing through ordinary life and tested faith. p.isaac--3af10add p.isaac.gene-26--da8ff3bc

name: Hagar
blurb: Hagar, Sarah’s Egyptian servant, becomes mother of Ishmael. The Angel of the LORD meets her in the wilderness; she names God ‘El-Roi’—‘the God who sees me.’ Her story shows God’s care for the oppresse
searchText: hagar person narrative hagar, sarah’s egyptian servant, becomes mother of ishmael. the angel of the lord meets her in the wilderness; she names god ‘el-roi’—‘the god who sees me.’ her story shows god’s care for the oppressed and his purposes extending beyond the covenant line. p.hagar--e298da9b

name: Ishmael
blurb: Abraham’s son by Hagar, named because God ‘heard’ Hagar’s affliction. God promises to make him a great nation; he fathers twelve princes. Though not the covenant heir, Ishmael is not outside God’s pro
searchText: ishmael person narrative abraham’s son by hagar, named because god ‘heard’ hagar’s affliction. god promises to make him a great nation; he fathers twelve princes. though not the covenant heir, ishmael is not outside god’s providential care. p.ishmael--dc59e15e
